text: hi i'm thomas renfess a professional
services consultant at aws specializing
in amazon connect
the topic for today's video is a new
feature in q a bot 5.1 called client
filtering
i will also show you how to connect your
lex web ui chat widget to amazon connect
to allow your customers to chat to a
customer service representative
client filtering lets you set a
parameter for each question stored in q
a bot
the answer to a question with a specific
client filter will only be returned if
the associated client filter value is
sent in with the query
this will allow you to store the same
question multiple times in the same q
a-bot instance
and control which answer is returned
based on the client filter parameter you
send in
for example
in my demo today i'll talk about a
fictitious university
each department at the university has
frequently asked questions
by sending in the department name as a
client filter value
we make sure that the correct response
is returned for each department
in an earlier video and blog post i've
introduced q a bot and demonstrated how
to integrate amazon connect with q a bot
if you haven't seen that video before
you might want to view that first
i've put the links to the video and the
blog post in the description below
i'll start the presentation today with
an overview of how client filters work
second i'll show you how to deploy lex
web ui with support for live chat and a
specific client filter defined
then i'll show you how to make use of
client filters in amazon connect
finally i'll show you both client
filters and live chat in action
we're now in the q a bot content
designer and i have a couple of example
questions imported you can import those
by going into
import
you extend the examples and extensions
and then you load the the client filter
demo questions here
the example questions relate to a
fictitious university you have two
departments engineering and computer
science
both have the same questions but the
answers for these questions are
different for the two departments
now if we go into the
the question about majors here for
engineering
we see that the response is specific to
engineering
and if we go under advanced
we can see
that we have a client filter value here
and this is new for q a bot 5.1
we've added in engineering as the client
filter value for this specific question
similarly if we go into computer science
for majors
we have different a different response
and the client filter value is set to sc
for computer science
so
depending on which client filter value
is sent in when you're asking the
question
you'll get a different response
now we have a different question here
for financial aid
now the response here is the same for
both departments
and in order to return
that same response we can add in
this both of these client filter values
just a space between them so we have
engineering and computer science
and both will be returned however if you
don't send in a client filter value at
all or you send in one that's not in
this list this response would not be
returned
if this response was valid for any
department you could have left the
client filter value blank
the answer would then be returned
regardless of what client filter value
was sent in if any
it's also possible to dynamically set
the client filter value
if we look at our set filter questions
here set filter sc
we set the session
attribute q a client filter to sc
and respond saying the client filter has
been set to computer science you should
now only get answers with the filter
either set not set at all or set to
computer
science and if you want to clear that
filter you can set the clear filter
question
that similarly sets the q a client
filter to nothing
for those of you that use the kendra faq
feature
please note that if a client filter is
set to anything other than an empty
string then the kendra faq is disabled
for that specific request

this way you can deploy several

and that comes back as well
now you do have the ability to use

so

about

and we should now get the

in amazon connect

spot
where we ask for

and it collects a slot
where i just have computer science in
school of engineering
that sets the value to sc or engineering
in the amazon connect contact flow i've
added a demo select department flow here
that calls that bot and then it checks a

checks to see the lex slot of school
that would have been filled
by the slot here
and it sets client filter to that value
from here the call progresses like

flow
and here we've made a slight

we're sending in
another session attribute
we're setting q a client filter to the

let's call in and try this out
which department are you calling about
engineering ask me a question
what undergraduate majors are available
the following are undergraduate majors
available for a bachelor of engineering
degree environmental engineering
electrical engineering computer
engineering industrial engineering and
mechanical engineering
ask another question or say return to

where's the administration office
the any school office of administration
for the school of engineering is located
at 123 example hall anytown washington
if you would like to speak with an

your visit
ask another question or say return to

where can i access financial aid
financial aid awards scholarships and

by selecting a specific school at the
beginning of the call and using that
information to set the client filter
value the caller received only
information valid for that specific

now that i've showed you how client
filtering works
both for lex web ui and in amazon
connect i'll conclude this demo by
showing you how you can transition a
chat from lex web ui to an agent in
amazon connect
if you want to enable live chat for your
lex web ui chat widget
just go into the stack
and update it setting should enable live
chat to true
also have a look at connect live chat
terms
the default is is live chat
but when we deployed this we also added
representative and agent
once the stack is updated
you'll notice that you have the option
in the top left corner
to start a live chat
we can also type in one of the live chat
terms down here
live chat
and we'll be asked for a name
before i type that in and get
transferred to an agent let's have a
look in amazon connect
when we deployed the stack we provided
the id of a contact flow that we wanted
to point the live chat to
so in this case we have q a bot transfer
to agent i'd created a contact flow
all it does is say please hold while we
transfer to the next available agent
i set the working queue to basic queue
and and then transfer the call
let me log in as an agent here so we can
receive this chat
there i'll set myself to available
now
let's type in a name here
john doe
just please hold while we connect you to
the next available agent
this should ring at the agent here here
we go incoming chat from john doe
so we'll answer this
now this shows the long id for my
developer account but this would be the
agent name
so we can say hello
it shows up on the client side and we'll
just respond with
i have a problem
and we can end the chat here
we're now back to talking to the q a bot
again so we can ask a question again
and we'll still get responses just like
previously from q a bot
and if we want to re-initialize a
communication with a live agent we can
either just type live agent or select it
from up here
now it remembers the name we typed in
earlier
so it now transfers back to the selected
queue and gets transferred to an
available agent
in order to make the transition to the
live agent as natural as possible you
have the option of sending along a
transcript of the conversation that
we've had with the bot previously
in order to be able to do this you need
to go into your amazon connect settings
here
go to data storage
attachments
we'll edit this to enable attachment
sharing
we need to provide an s3 bucket to store
these attachments
you have the option of putting in a path
prefix here and enabling encryption
in your lex web ui stack make sure that
connect attach chat transcript is set to
true
for the transcript feature to work
you'll also need to update the course
settings for the s3 bucket that was
created when you enable attachments
you'll find an example of the required
configuration in the connect live chat
readme in the lex web ui github
repository
copy the example configuration
go to your attachments s3 bucket
click on permissions
and scroll down to cross account
resource sharing
click edit
and
paste the example here
you'll need to update the allowed
origins
to match your account configurations
the first origin is the access url to
your amazon connect instance
if you've deployed a custom control
panel with a different url use that one
instead
the second allowed origin is the
cloudfront distribution url for your
lexweb ui deployment
and once you've updated these click save
now that we've completed these
configurations we can try this again
we'll ask it a question
and then try the live chat
we'll enter a name
we'll accept this chat
the agent now gets a transcript of the
conversation that was had with the
chatbot prior to the conversation being
transferred to a live agent
we also get a file with a complete
transcript that can be downloaded
thanks for spending some time learning
about client filtering and live chat for
more information have a look at the lex
web ui blog and the github repository as
